data.title: Actors Born on April 28
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays in film and TV for the 28th of April. Browse actors, actresses and directors that were born on April 28.
data.text:
Lester Lonergan, Irish-American stage and screen actor and director (Seven Faces), born in Limerick, Ireland, UK (d. 1931)

[Hooper] Sidney Toler, American theater director, playwright, stage and screen actor (Madame X; Meeting at Midnight; Charlie Chan films, 1938-46), born in Warrensburg, Missouri (d. 1947)

Lionel Barrymore

American actor (It's A Wonderful Life; Dr. Kildare (films); Key Largo), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Bryant Washburn, American actor (Exposure, Millionaire Kid, Nabonga), born in Chicago, Illinois (d. 1963)

Corry [Cornelia Diderika] Vonk, Dutch actress (Bleeke Bet), born in Amsterdam (d. 1988)

Michael Fitzmaurice, American radio actor (Superman, Reported Missing, 14 Hours), born in Chicago, Illinois (d. 1967)

Oskar Schindler

Austrian businessman and subject of the novel "Schindler's Ark" and the film "Schindler's List", born in Zwittau, Austria-Hungary

Robert Cornthwaite, American actor (Thing, War of the Worlds, What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?), born in St. Helens, Oregon (d. 2006)

Nan Merriman, American-Dutch singer (Arturo Toscanini NBC Orchestra), born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (d. 2012)

Rowland Evans, American news reporter (CNN-Evans & Novak), born in Whitemarsh, Pennsylvania (d. 2001)

Adele Mara [Adelaida Delgado], American actress, singer and dancer (Cool Million, Wheels), born in Highland Park, Michigan (d. 2010)

1923 William Guarnere, American WWII veteran and author, portrayed in the HBO miniseries Band of Brothers, born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (d. 2014)

Donatas Banionis, Lithuanian actor (Solaris, Goya or the Hard Way to Enlightenment), born in Kaunas, Lithuania (d. 2014)

Laura Weber, American folk guitarist, educator, and public television host, born in New York City (d. 1995)

Carolyn Jones

American actress (Morticia-Addams Family), born in Amarillo, Texas

Richard C. Sarafian, American director and actor (Foley Square), born in New York City (d. 2013)

Fred Dibnah, English steeplejack and television personality, born in Bolton, Lancashire, England (d. 2004)

1938 Madge Sinclair (née Walters), Jamaican-American actress (Conrack; Roots - "Bell"; Trapper John, M.D. - "Ernestine"; The Lion King), born in Kingston, Colony of Jamaica (d. 1995)

Ann-Margret [Olsson], Swedish-American actress (Bye Bye Birdie; Viva Las Vegas: Tommy; Grumpy Old Men), and singer, born in Valsjöbyn, Sweden

Ginette Reno [Raynault], Canadian Juno Award-winning pop singer-songwriter ("Beautiful Second Hand Man"), and actress, born in Montreal, Quebec

Dorothée Berryman, Canadian stage and screen actress (The Decline of the American Empire), and jazz singer, born in Quebec City, Quebec

1948 Marcia Strassman, American actress (M*A*S*H; Welcome Back, Kotter - "Julie Kotter"), born in New York City (d. 2014)

Bruno Kirby, American actor (d. 2006)

1949 Paul Guilfoyle, American actor (CSI, Mrs. Doubtfire), born in Boston, Massachusetts

Jay Leno

American comedian and TV talk show host (Tonight Show), born in New Rochelle, New York

1950 Willie Colón, American salsa music pioneer producer (Fania Records), singer, trombonist, actor (The Last Fight), and social activist, born in The Bronx, New York City

Mary McDonnell, American actress (Sneakers, Independence Day), born in Wilkes-Barre Pennsylvania

Jeremy John Beadle, British critic, writer and broadcaster, born in York, England (d. 1995)

Nancy Lee Grahn, American actress (Santa Barbara), born in Evanston, Illinois

John Cerutti, American baseball pitcher (Toronto Blue Jays) and broadcaster (Rogers Sportsnet), born in Albany, New York (d. 2004)

Noriyuki Iwadare, Japanese video game music composer, born in Matsumoto City, Nagano, Japan

Steven Blum, American deep-voiced voice actor, born in Santa Monica, California

Jeff Grosso, American skateboarder (host Youtube’s 'Vans Loveletters to Skateboarding'), born in Glendale, California (d. 2020)

Bridget Moynahan, American actress, born in Binghamton, New York

1971 Chris Young, Penn, actor (Bryce Lynch-Max Headroom, Great Outdoors)

1971 Simbi Khali, American actress (Nina-3rd Rock From the Sun)

Elisabeth Röhm, American actress, born in Düsseldorf, Germany

1973 Jorge Garcia, American actor (Lost), born in Omaha, Nebraska

Penélope Cruz

Spanish actress (Vanilla Sky, Waking Up in Reno), born in Madrid, Spain

Drew Scott, Canadian TV personality (Property Brothers), born in Vancouver, British Columbia

1978 Jonathan Scott, Canadian TV personality (Property Brothers), born in Vancouver, British Columbia

1978 Lauren Laverne [Gofton], British disc jockey, television presenter and punk-pop singer [Kenickie], born in Sunderland, England

1978 Nate Richert, American actor (Harvey-Sabrina), born in Saint Paul, Minnesota

Bahram Radan, Iranian actor (The Passion of Love), born in Tehran, Iran

Jessica Alba

American actress (Dark Angel, Sin City) and businesswoman (The Honest Company), born in Pomona, California

Harry Shum Jr. Costa Rican actor (Glee, Shadowhunters), born in Limón, Costa Rica

1982 Nikki Grahame, English TV personality (Big Brother), born in London, England

Samantha Ruth Prabhu, Indian actress (Neethaane En Ponvasantham), born in Madras, India

Tony Revolori [Anthony Quiñonez], American actor (The Grand Budapest Hotel), born in Anaheim, California
